page.title: 12GOVERNMENT:BED'HM:HED'HM
page.content: Both parishes have an electorate of 150+/- & each has by choice a Parish Meeting not a Parish Council.Parish Meetings consist of the entire elect- orate who must be called to meet bi- ennially & who elect a Chairman ann- ually;they are the only examples of direct rather than representative dem- ocracy in the Constitution,but have few powers.They may precept on the rates for expenses & maintenance of churchyard,War Memorial & phone box only. Bedingham has income from 2a. granted in the 1843 Enclosure Award; the grazing being auctioned each spring at the PM. Bedingham recently won the right to use its income as it thinks fit. PMs are consulted on plan- ning & other matters of direct concern The Parish Charities are now combined, the funds administered by elected Trustees & used for quiet local help.
